main event: An observer reported seeing a round, star-like object at a 45-degree elevation traveling to the southeast, which lasted for 5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as resembling a first magnitude star and appeared blueish white., The object was visible over the horizon and was identified as likely being a meteorite., The sighting occurred at night but under moonlight conditions., Binoculars were available but not necessary for observation., The event was recorded in a Project Blue Book file dated 6 December 1962.
